hero.title: Powering Resilience with Deep Science & AI.
hero.subtitle: We fuse Earth Observation data, heavy climatic modeling, and advanced Machine Learning to transform uncertainty into actionable metrics.

intro.title: The ClimaVista Engine
intro.description: Our technology stack processes petabytes of environmental data to support parametric insurance, early warning systems, and portfolio management.

layer1_data.title: 1. Multi-Source Observation Layer
layer1_data.subtitle: We capture the pulse of the planet using the most reliable constellations and ground networks.

sources.name: Optical & Radar Satellites
sources.detail: Sentinel-2 (NDVI), Sentinel-1 (SAR) for crop health monitoring even through clouds.

sources.name: Geostationary Satellites
sources.detail: GOES & Meteosat for real-time storm tracking and rapid fire detection.

sources.name: Climate Reanalysis
sources.detail: ERA5 & CHIRPS providing 40+ years of historical consistency for risk pricing.

sources.name: IoT & Ground Stations
sources.detail: Local validation networks to calibrate satellite proxies against ground truth.

layer2_ai.title: 2. Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning
layer2_ai.subtitle: Raw data is noisy. Our AI layer cleans, reconstructs, and enhances data to achieve insurance-grade precision.

features.title: Smart Gap-Filling
features.description: Using Deep Learning (GANs) to reconstruct missing optical data obscured by cloud cover, ensuring continuous monitoring.

features.title: Bias Correction
features.description: Machine Learning algorithms calibrate large-scale weather models against local station data to reduce basis risk.

features.title: Yield Prediction Models
features.description: Proprietary AI models trained on decades of agronomic data to forecast crop yields and trigger parametric payouts accurately.

features.title: Pattern Recognition
features.description: Computer vision automatically detects extreme events like hail scars or flood extent from radar imagery.

layer3_models.title: 3. Probabilistic Modeling
layer3_models.subtitle: For our Early Warning System, we rely on the power of 'Ensemble' forecasting.
layer3_models.description: We aggregate over 200 forecast members from NOAA (GFS), ECMWF (IFS), and DWD (ICON) every 6 hours. This approach quantifies uncertainty and extends lead times by 12+ hours compared to deterministic models.

validation.title: Scientific Validation
validation.text: Every index and model is rigorously backtested against 30 years of historical data and validated by local agronomic institutes to ensure fair and transparent triggers.
